title: By 'dramatizing' debt issue, French PM Bayrou risks exacerbating democratic fatigue
subhead: French Prime Minister François Bayrou's call for sacrifices fuels us-and-them populist rhetoric and could alienate citizens who already expect little from politics.

title: France's Socialists present budget plan to navigate post-Bayrou era
subhead: The budget proposals put forward by the Socialists reveal a heightened sense of caution compared to previous left-wing estimates. They are intended to carry weight in upcoming discussions over the formation of a new government, ahead of Prime Minister François Bayrou's anticipated fall on Monday.

title: NATO: Europe is caught in Trump's 'protection racket'
subhead: The Europeans, eager to keep the US from abandoning Ukraine, waver between submission and emancipation. Yet for Trump, who doesn't heed political or moral arguments, NATO must, above all, pay off, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Paris Design Week: A 15th edition marked by abundance
subhead: Some 375 locations across the French capital are hosting, free of charge from September 4 to 13, the very best in contemporary design. From Aude Franjou's textile coral installation to Hugo Falaise's embroidered furniture, here is our selection of must-see works.

title: Giorgio Armani, one of the makers of modern fashion, is dead
subhead: Creator, designer and stylist, he made the tailored suit into a status symbol. Armani, who reigned for more than 40 years over a veritable empire, died on Thursday, September 4, at the age of 91, his fashion house confirmed.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'To succeed in the climate transition, we must redistribute wealth differently'
